abstract_summ: The expansion of telehealth services is expected to deliver timely care for the initial screening of symptomatic patients while minimizing exposure in health care facilities, to protect health care providers and other patients.METHODS: Visit outcome and patient demographic data were obtained via electronic health record (EHR) reports.MATERIALS AND METHODS: Our health system deployed four COVID-19 telehealth programs, and four biomedical informatics innovations to screen and care for COVID-19 patients.PURPOSE: To describe the first 30 days of rapid adolescent telehealth scale-up in response to the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic at a single academic medical center and assess for disparities in visit completion rates by patient characteristics.Patients coded as non-white (African-American, Asian, or other) in the EHR had lower visit completion rates than white patients (p = .003).
title_summ: Interest and Telehealth Capacity of US Hospitals in Response to COVID-19: Cross-Sectional Analysis of Google Search and National Hospital Survey DataLeveraging Health System Telehealth and Informatics Infrastructure to Create a Continuum of Services for COVID-19 Screening, Testing, and TreatmentOutcomes of a Rapid Adolescent Telehealth Scale-Up During the COVID-19 PandemicThe Application of Mobile Telehealth System to Facilitate Patient Information Presentation and Case Discussion.Telehealth Uptake into Prenatal Care and Provider Attitudes during the COVID-19 Pandemic in New York City: A Quantitative and Qualitative Analysis.Staying Connected In The COVID-19 Pandemic: Telehealth At The Largest Safety-Net System In The United States.Population-Level
title_abstract_phrases: The expansion of telehealth services is expected to deliver timely care for the initial screening of symptomatic patients while minimizing exposure in health care facilities, to protect health care providers and other patients.METHODS: Visit outcome and patient demographic data were obtained via electronic health record (EHR) reports.MATERIALS AND METHODS: Our health system deployed four COVID-19 telehealth programs, and four biomedical informatics innovations to screen and care for COVID-19 patients.Through linking the telehealth systems and the electronic health record, we have the ability to monitor and track patients through a continuum of COVID-19 services.We anticipate that patients and providers will view enhanced telehealth services as an essential aspect of the healthcare system.
